text: The Gers is a river in France. It flows through the Hautes-Pyrénées, Gers and Lot-et-Garonne departments, in the Occitanie and Nouvelle-Aquitaine regions. The Gers department is named after this river. The river's source is in the Pyrenees. It is a left tributary of the Garonne river. In general, it flows from south to north. ==Geography== The Gers river has a length of and a drainage basin with an area of . ===Course=== The source of the Gers is on the Plateau de Lannemezan, in the Lannemezan commune (Hautes-Pyrénées), at an altitude of . The Gers passes through the departments and towns of: * Hautes- Pyrénées : Lannemezan, Monléon-Magnoac * Gers : Chélan, Panassac, Masseube, Seissan, Pavie, Auch, Preignan, Montestruc-sur-Gers, Fleurance, Lectoure * Lot-et-Garonne : Astaffort, Layrac The Gers river flows through 48 communes and 11 cantons. Finally, it flows into the Garonne river to the south of Agen (Lot-et-Garonne), in the Layrac commune, at of altitude. ==Main tributaries == * Left tributaries ** Gèze - ** Cédon - ** Sousson - ** Talouch - ** Ousse - ** Lauze - ** Auchie - * Right tributaries ** Cier - ** Arçon - ** Aulouste - ==Gallery== File:Gers bij Sariac-Magnoac.JPG|The Gers river in Sariac-Magnoac File:Pavie - Vieux Pont -1.JPG|Old bridge on the Gers, Pavie File:La digue sur le Gers à Ornézan.jpg|The Gers river in Ornézan ==Related pages== * List of rivers of France == References == ==Other websites== * Banque Hydro - MEDDE, «Synthèse de la Banque Hydro - (O6372510)» Category:Rivers of Nouvelle-Aquitaine Category:Rivers of Occitanie
